result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:20 PM Defendant Nicholas R Lohmeier appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by video for Nicholas R Lohmeier.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement received.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.  
Initial appearance is reset to 07-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. felony bail jumping, possess THC, possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with Brent Boeldt and the residence of 820 S. 24th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220, and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 48 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 05-23-22.
